properties.areaDesc: Liberty; Eastern Pondera; Toole; Eastern Glacier
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 12 at 9:09AM MST until January 13 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Great Falls MT
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills
expected. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. For the Winter
Weather Advisory, snow occurring. Additional snow accumulations
of 1 to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph.

* WHERE...Eastern Glacier, Toole, Liberty, and Eastern Pondera
Counties.

* WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from 6 PM this evening to
noon MST Monday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 11 AM
MST Monday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow
could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind
chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5
minutes.
properties.instruction:
Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you
wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

Slow down and use caution while traveling.

To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on
young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs
then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST MONDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON MST MONDAY
